etymologies: late Middle English: from Latin directus, past participle of dirigere, from di- ‘distinctly’ or de- ‘down’ + regere ‘put straight’

definitions: extending or moving from one place to another by the shortest way without changing direction or stopping

examples.text: there was no direct flight that day

shortDefinitions: going somewhere without stopping or changing direction

definitions: (of apparent planetary motion) proceeding from west to east in accord with actual motion.
shortDefinitions: referring to apparent planetary motion from west to east

definitions: without intervening factors or intermediaries

examples.text: the complications are a direct result of bacteria spreading

shortDefinitions: without intervening factors or intermediaries

definitions: (of light or heat) proceeding from a source without being reflected or blocked

examples.text: ferns like a bright position out of direct sunlight

shortDefinitions: (of light or heat) coming directly from source

definitions: (of genealogy) proceeding in continuous succession from parent to child

examples.text: a direct descendant of Edward III

shortDefinitions: (of genealogy) proceeding directly from parent to child

definitions: (of a quotation) taken from someone's words without being changed.
shortDefinitions: taken from someone's words without being changed

definitions: (of taxation) levied on income or profits rather than on goods or services.
shortDefinitions: (of taxation) levied on income or profits rather than on goods or services

definitions: complete (used for emphasis)

examples.text: nonviolence is the direct opposite of compulsion

shortDefinitions: complete

definitions: (of a person or their behavior) going straight to the point; frank

examples.text: he is very direct and honest

shortDefinitions: going straight to the point

definitions: (of evidence or proof) bearing immediately and unambiguously upon the facts at issue

examples.text: there is no direct evidence that officials accepted bribes

shortDefinitions: clear and unambiguous

definitions: perpendicular to a surface; not oblique

examples.text: a direct butt joint between surfaces of steel

shortDefinitions: perpendicular to a surface

definitions: with no one or nothing in between

examples.text: buy direct and save

shortDefinitions: with no one or nothing in between

definitions: by a straight route or without breaking a journey

examples.text: Austrian Airlines is flying direct to Innsbruck again

shortDefinitions: by straight route or unbroken journey

definitions: control the operations of; manage or govern

examples.text: an economic elite directed the nation's affairs

shortDefinitions: control operations of

definitions: supervise and control (a movie, play, or other production, or the actors in it)

examples.text: the film is directed by Sir Richard Attenborough

shortDefinitions: supervise and control film, play, etc.

definitions: train and conduct (a group of musicians).
shortDefinitions: train and conduct group of musicians

definitions: aim (something) in a particular direction or at a particular person

examples.text: heating ducts to direct warm air to rear-seat passengers
his smile was directed at Laura

shortDefinitions: aim in particular direction etc.

definitions: tell or show (someone) how to get somewhere

examples.text: can you direct me to the railroad station, please?

shortDefinitions: tell someone how to get somewhere

definitions: address or give instructions for the delivery of (a letter or parcel)

examples.text: put them all in one packet, and direct them to me

shortDefinitions: address letter or parcel

definitions: focus or concentrate (one's attention, efforts, or feelings) on

examples.text: we direct our anger and frustration at family

shortDefinitions: focus one's thoughts on or address one's efforts towards something

definitions: address a comment to or aim a criticism at

examples.text: I suggest that he direct his remarks to the council
he directed his criticism at media coverage of the Catholic Church

shortDefinitions: address comment to

definitions: target a product specifically at (someone)

examples.text: the book is directed at the younger reader

shortDefinitions: target product at

definitions: guide or advise (someone or their judgment) in a course or decision

examples.text: the conscience of the credulous prince was directed by saints and bishops

shortDefinitions: guide or advise

definitions: give (someone) an official order or authoritative instruction

examples.text: the judge directed him to perform community service
he directed that no picture from his collection could be sold

shortDefinitions: give order or instruction to
